description: Dive into "Capturing Mysuru: A Photographic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Mysuru: A Photographic Journey

places.generalDescription: Lokaranjan Aqua World Underwater Zoo is a popular attraction in Mysore, India, located near the Mysore Zoo. It is known as the largest underwater aquarium in the country and features an impressive "underwater glass tunnel" that provides visitors with a unique underwater experience. The zoo showcases a diverse range of fish species and offers an engaging environment for both children and adults to learn about marine life.

sources.snippet: Lokaranjan Aqua World is a modern underwater aquarium near Mysore Palace that immerses you in marine life through its tunnel-aquarium design. You walk through a glass tunnel surrounded by tanks holding stingrays, silver sharks, koi butterflyfish, starfish, and lobsters, among others. Children love the layout because tanks are set at accessible heights and lighting highlights the colors and movement of fish.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Mysore, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: At a distance of 3 km from Mysore Railway Station, Lokaranjan Aqua World is an underwater aquarium in Mysore. Situated close to Mysore Zoo, it is the largest underwater aquarium in India, and among the must-include places in Mysore packages.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Lokaranjan Aqua World Underwater Zoo

reviews.text:
I have been visiting Aqua World every year, and I never get bored of watching the beautiful fishes. You can see a wide variety of species here, each more fascinating than the other.

The entire place is air-conditioned, making the visit comfortable. There are seating arrangements inside, and snacks are also available to enjoy while you relax.

It's a wonderful spot to spend some time-definitely worth a visit. Do come and enjoy the experience!

This year they have added new good look with jelly fishes.. It's so beautiful.

Attached video and photos for the reference..

Nice setup but not worth the hype. The underwater tunnel and colorful fish are good for one-time experience, especially for kids. But the ticket price is too high (‚Çπ300 per person) for what you get.

The place is clean and maintained okay, but the overall vibe is just average - nothing special or wow. Feels more like a quick visit place, not something you'd go back to again.

Would recommend only if you're visiting with children or want to see it once for the tunnel. For solo travelers or couples, it may feel overpriced and underwhelming.

Pros: Good for kids, colorful fish, underwater tunnel
Cons: Overpriced tickets, small area, normal

This place is still in the process of development. Lot more to be done. Though the cost of entry ticket is on the slightly higher side, we enjoyed the colourful variety of fishes available.  They have a place for feeding the fishes too. Naming of the species is not yet done.

places.address: 853-n-15 Zoo Garden Road, 15b, Lokaranjan Mahal Rd, Indira Nagar, Ittige Gudu, Mysuru, Karnataka 570010, India

places.generalDescription: Mysore Palace, a stunning Indo-Saracenic architectural marvel completed in 1912, boasts a grand durbar hall and hosts weekly illuminations. The palace is famous for the traditional Dasara procession, Jamboo Savari, featuring a decorated elephant carrying the idol of Goddess Chamundeshwari during Vijaya Dashami. This centuries-old celebration was initiated by Raja Wodeyar in 1610 and has continued uninterrupted.

sources.snippet: One of Incredible India‚Äôs iconic landmarks, the Amba Vilas Palace or the Mysore Palace, is the second most visited tourist attraction in India after the Taj Mahal. It is estimated that more than 8 million people visit this palace every year, most of whom visit during the colorful and regal Dasara festival. There are 3 things that are noteworthy when it comes to the Mysore Palace.
sources.siteName: Be On The Road | Live your Travel Dream!
sources.shortName: Mysore Palace: A Destination for Photography Be On The Road

sources.snippet: The Mysore Palace is an architectural wonder covered in more than 100,000 light bulbs during Dasara, producing a magnificent environment ideal for photography. Perfect times: The ideal times for shooting are nighttime when the palace is lit (7 PM to 10 PM). Early dawn views could also catch the palace in soft light before the crowds arrive.
sources.shortName: Top Locations in Mysuru for Captivating Navratri Photography

sources.snippet: The epitome of magnificence of Mysuru is the Mysore Palace that has been a favorite among shutterbugs. With Indo-Saracenic architecture aglow with thousands of light bulbs during festivals it becomes a sight to behold. The artwork on its walls, ornamental ceilings and grandeur hall can be locked in your camera lens.
sources.shortName: Capture The Bliss With Top 7 Best Places For Photography In Mysuru

sources.snippet: Special features: Royal palace, Indo-Saracenic architecture, grandeur.Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:30 PM (Lighting timings: 7:00 PM to 7:45 PM)Website: https://mysorepalace.karnataka.gov.in/Location charges: INR 2,000 onwards for pre-wedding shoots (varies based on requirements).
sources.shortName: 20 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Mysore (October 2024)

sources.snippet: Mysore Palace, also known as Mysore Maharaja Palace is one among the largest palaces in India. It is situated in the city‚Äôs center. The palace was built in the year 1897 using wood, which was damaged due to fire.
sources.shortName: Stunning 8 Places In Mysore, The ‚ÄòCity Of Palaces‚Äô

places.name: Mysuru Palace

reviews.text: The Mysore Palace is a true architectural wonder. The intricate carvings, beautiful domes, and royal interiors are a feast for the eyes. I was amazed by how grand and majestic the entire place felt. The evening light show made it even more magical. It's a must-visit place if you're in Karnataka. Highly recommended for history lovers and architecture enthusiasts!

Place is good and Maintained. We went during public holiday so it was so much crowded and we didn't get to see inside of the palace properly. The ticket cost is around 120 Rupees which I didn't think it was worth it as there was no crowd management. But overall good visit and good experience.

Palace is very beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏è

Pros
1. Rich mix of culture and history.
2. Huge campus so it doesn't get crowded.
3. Very well maintained.

Cons
1. Tickets for the Palace is separate from the Light and Sound show.
2. To buy the tickets for the light and aound show you'll have to come outside of the palace again and get in a queue for the tickets.

places.generalDescription: Chamundeshwari Temple is a Shakti peeth located in Mysuru, offering a serene hill and valley view. Visitors are advised to arrive before 3pm to ensure access to the main chamber for Darshana. The temple also provides an opportunity to visit the Brahmakumari museum. Many travelers have expressed their love for this peaceful and spiritually fulfilling place, making it an ideal destination for those seeking tranquility and blessings from the goddess Chamundeshwari.

sources.snippet: They can simply plan a easy day trip from Bangalore, which includes a visit to the Chamundeshwari temple in the morning followed by a traditional Mylari Dosa breakfast and then visits to the Mysore Palace, museums, Brindavan garden, shopping districts and other attractions before returning to Bangalore in the evening. For people from other states, they can easily base themselves in Mysore and enjoy its relaxed pace and lush green environment.
sources.siteName: Be On The Road | Live your Travel Dream!
sources.shortName: Mysore Palace: A Destination for Photography Be On The Road

places.name: Shree Chamundeshwari Devi Temple

reviews.text:
Chamundeshwari Temple ‚Äì Divine Views & Deep Peace üõïüåÑ

My visit to Chamundeshwari Temple was a truly serene and spiritual experience. Located atop the Chamundi Hills, the journey itself felt sacred - with breathtaking views of Mysore city unfolding along the way.

The temple, dedicated to Goddess Chamundeshwari, is rich in history, power, and devotion. The divine presence can truly be felt the moment you enter. The architecture is beautiful, the surroundings peaceful, and the energy-unmatched.

Climbing the famous 1,000 steps or simply driving up gives a sense of devotion and calm. The darshan was smooth, and the view from the top was absolutely worth the visit - especially during sunrise or sunset!

It's more than just a temple; it's a place to pause, reflect, and reconnect. A must-visit when you're in Mysore for spiritual seekers and peace lovers alike. üôèüå∏

The Chamundeshwari Temple is one of the most sacred and iconic temples in Mysore, situated on the Chamundi Hills. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Chamundeshwari, the presiding deity of Mysore. The atmosphere here is very peaceful and spiritual, with a beautiful view of the entire Mysore city from the hilltop.

‚ú® Highlights:

The temple's architecture is stunning with its tall, intricately carved gopuram.

Well-maintained premises and a strong spiritual vibe.

Panoramic view of Mysore Palace and the city lights from the hill.

Free shoe-stand and drinking water facility available.

‚è∞ Best Time to Visit: Early morning or evening to avoid crowds and enjoy pleasant weather.
üöó Accessibility: You can reach the temple by car, bus, or even by climbing the 1,000+ steps for a divine experience.

This is my go-to temple for its peaceful vibes and the incredible experience it offers. The ride up the ghat road, especially on a bike, is thrilling and scenic. From the hilltop, you get a breathtaking panoramic view of the entire Mysore city.

Though it tends to get crowded, the wait is absolutely worth it. The area also features a large number of shopping stalls, adding to the lively atmosphere.

places.address: Shri Chamundeshwari Temple Road, Chamundi Hill, Mysuru, Karnataka 570010, India

places.generalDescription: Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens, commonly known as Mysuru Zoo, is a well-established and popular zoo located near the palace in Mysore, India. It was established by Sri Chamarajendra Wadiyar Bahadur and is known for its cleanliness, conservation breeding of endangered species, and recreation of natural habitats for captive animals.

sources.snippet: Commonly referred as Mysore Zoo, Shri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens is placed adjacent to Karanji lake. One of the oldest zoos in the country, it was established in 1892 by the Kings of Mysore as part of the summer palace of Maharaja Sri Chamaraja Wodeyar. It features as one of the most popular tourist places in Mysore.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Places in Mysore To Visit

places.name: Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens (Mysuru Zoo)

reviews.text:
Visited the Mysore Zoo and had a great experience!!! The zoo is very well maintained, clean, and has a wide variety of animals, birds, and reptiles.

Loved how the enclosures are spacious and designed for the animals to roam and for us to view the animals without any visual disturbance.

There's a clear walking path, drinking water, rest rooms, souvenir shop and shaded rest spots.

It's a peaceful place to enjoy nature and wildlife. It took about 2‚Äì4 hours to cover fully depending on how you want to cover.

Highly recommended for families, kids, and nature lovers. It felt good to see such a well organized zoo with a variety of species.

I recently visited Mysore Zoo and had a wonderful experience. The place is very well maintained with clean and green surroundings, which makes walking around really pleasant. The animal enclosures are neat and tidy, and it's nice to see that the animals are kept in good care. It's also a lovely spot for kids ‚Äì they really enjoy seeing such a wide variety of animals up close. The only thing that could be improved is the canteen, which was a bit disappointing compared to the overall standard of the zoo. Otherwise, it's definitely a place worth visiting when in Mysore.

Clean, green and really well run-Mysore Zoo is a pleasure to walk. Enclosures feel spacious, the collection is superb (great apes, big cats, giraffes), and the paths are shaded with plenty of drinking-water points. Staff are efficient, battery buggies/wheelchairs help elders, and the plastic-free policy is a big plus. It gets crowded on weekends and the loop is long, so wear comfy shoes. Overall: a fantastic family outing and wildlife lover's stop.

Pro tip: Go early for active animals, then wind down at nearby Karanji Lake.

places.address: Zoo Rd, Indira Nagar, Ittige Gudu, Mysuru, Karnataka 570010, India

places.generalDescription: The Mysuru Rail Museum is a museum dedicated to the history of rail transport in India. The museum has a large collection of photographs and exhibits detailing the development of rail transportation in India. The railway engine is also prominently featured in the museum, with various stages of its development depicted on display.

sources.snippet: At a distance of about 500 meters from Mysore Railway Station & 2.5 Kms from KSRTC Bus Station, Railway Museum is situated adjacent to the railway station on Krishnaraja Sagar Road. This Museum was established in 1979 by Indian Railways and it was the earliest railway museums set up in India. A visit to Railway Museum is one of the top things to do in Mysore.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Special features: Museum, vintage locomotives, train exhibits.Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:30 PMWebsite: No official website available.Location charges: INR 1,000 onwards for pre-wedding shoots (varies based on requirements).
sources.shortName: 20 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Mysore (October 2024)
25 Best Places to Visit in Mysore | Nearby Tourist Attractions

places.name: MYSURU RAILWAY MUSEUM

reviews.text:
Came across this museum during my stay (adjacent to the railway station), and it was definitely worth a visit. It was renovated and re-opened in 2020. It is well organized and celebrates the rich history of Indian railways and achievements. Museum has galleries with instruments used in the past such as communication and signaling tools, engines evolution, royal coaches, rails, RPF uniforms, and a toy train (star attraction), with an outdoor park including a children's play area, and a watch tower to enjoy the scenic beauty of Mysore. You can enjoy a quick snack at the train themed cafeteria.

Ticket is Rs 50 for adults and can only be paid by cash. A souvenir store is also attached for last min purchases.

Visited on weekend (sunday)
The Rail Museum in Mysore is a wonderful place to explore, especially for railway enthusiasts and families with kids. One of the main highlights is the toy train ride, which is a fun experience for both children and adults. It adds a playful touch to the visit and gives a mini-tour of the museum grounds. The toy train fee is included in the entry ticket itself. They will tear the toy train ticket at entry to train.
Entry fee is little higher for kids as well adult.
Rs. 50 for adults and Rs. 20 for kids (5 to 12 years)
We will spend around 1.5 hours in a museum.

They have NOT  provided Drinking water for visitors. It' must be arranged ASAP.

Bags and camera like DSLR will not allowed.
Free baggage counter available after entering.

The museum also does a great job showcasing the rich history of Indian Railways. From vintage locomotives to old photographs and railway artifacts, there's a lot to see and learn. It's a nostalgic journey through time and well-curated for history lovers.

One area for improvement is the cafeteria, where prices are noticeably higher than the MRP. It would be great if the authorities could look into this to make it more reasonable for visitors.

Overall, it's a great spot to spend a couple of hours, especially if you enjoy trains or want to show kids something different and educational.

I wondered what possibly could be included in this railway museum. And turned out that it's an eye catchy, vibrant collection of vintage trains. It showcases a linear progression that we as humans have made in locomotive sector. It's a very good spot for taking photos as well as to introduce kids to the history of railway system. You can also take a toy train ride for ‚Çπ50/- per person, even though it is for a very short distance. They have a cafeteria inside. Every corners of the museum felt picturesque and relaxing. It literally felt like someone has placed these beautiful vintage trains in a park. They have also preserved royal carriages with all the facilities inside.

places.address: 8J8V+G8P, KRS Rd, opp. CFTRI, Medar Block, Yadavagiri, Mysuru, Karnataka 570005, India

places.generalDescription: Sand Museum Mysuru is a unique and compact museum showcasing intricate sand sculptures. The museum features around 150 sand statues exploring 16 different themes, including Goddess Chamundeshwari, Mysore Dasara, Bhagavad Gita, wildlife, Disneyland, ancient civilizations and more. One of the main attractions is a 15-feet high statue of Lord Ganesha at the entrance. The museum offers a serene environment to appreciate each sculpture thoroughly.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 6 km from Mysore Railway Station, the Mysore Sand Sculpture Museum is a unique museum situated in Mysore. Located on the way to Chamundi Hills, this is the first sand sculpture museum in India, and among the prominent places for sightseeing in Mysore.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Sand Museum Mysuru

reviews.text: The Sand Museum in Mysore is quite unique and worth a visit if you're exploring the city. The sculptures are detailed and showcase impressive craftsmanship, especially considering they're all made of sand. However, the place isn't very large, and you can cover it fairly quickly. Maintenance could be better, as some parts don't look very well preserved. It's not a must-visit attraction, but if you're nearby and curious, it's an interesting stop for a short visit.

It's a very well maintained museum. Can't stop appreciating the Karnataka government for thinking of these creative museums and setting up in Mysore. There is a lot of creative work with sand here. It seems they keep updating it too. I see latest art work

The sand sculptures are beautifully crafted. They also have a few small shops inside selling traditional fashion items, which adds to the experience.

The only thing is, the museum is smaller than I expected. Still, a unique and enjoyable visit.

places.address: Chamundi Hill Rd, KC Layout, Mysuru, Karnataka 570011, India

places.generalDescription: Kishkindha Moolika Bonsai Garden, located in Mysore, is a renowned attraction known for its extensive collection of miniaturized bonsai trees, palm trees, and rare medicinal herbs. Established by HH Dr. Sri Ganapathy Sachchidananda Swamiji, the garden spans 4 acres and features over 100 species of bonsai trees.

sources.snippet: Touted as one of the biggest bonsai gardens in the country, the Kishkindha Moolika Bonsai Garden is a part of Avadhoota Datta Peetham Ashram. The main attraction of the garden is more than 250 varieties of bonsai trees on display. Trees are said to be grouped reflecting various themes including Indian music, Indian sages, and zodiac signs.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Places in Mysore To Visit

sources.snippet: Another park established by Sri Ganapathy Sachchidananda Swamiji which one can visit in Mysore, if there is enough time, is the Kishkindha Moolika Bonsai Garden. A home to an extensive range of bonsai plant species, this garden is spread over an area of four acres. More than 450 species of bonsai trees can be seen in this garden.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to Visit in Mysore

sources.snippet: At a distance of 5 km from Mysore Railway Station, Kishkinda Moolika Bonsai Garden is a famous garden located in Mysore, Karnataka. Next to Sukha Vana, it is one of the popular places to visit as part of the Mysore - Coorg tour packages.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: The Bonsai Garden of Mysore is home to over a 100 different varieties of Bonsai trees spread across a vast estate of about 4 acres. It is a part of the Avadoota Datta Peetham of the Sri Ganapathi Sachidananda Ashrama.
sources.shortName: 36 Best Places to visit in Mysore | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Kishkindha Moolika Bonsai Garden

reviews.text:
Oh my God! It's sooooo amazing!I have been to bonsai gardens around the world and I have never seen this many old bonsais in one place!

It's so well kept, and the plants are truly beautiful!

I can't believe this isn't recommended more, it's a must go if you love plants!

Also, you should plan to be there right when it opens - there is a museum that you get entry to (I didn't get to go there because I ran out of time) and a free exotic bird sanctuary (which I also couldn't see because... Time).

I'm going back, and the gardener is going to give us a private tour!
It's a very beautiful and unique place. They have maintained it so well. It's quiet and peaceful and the bonsai garden is so fascinating to look at. The staff is also very friendly and helpful.

This place is just amazing. It's holds guinness world üåç record for most number of bonsai tress. It has 200+ year old tree. Check for closing time it'll remain closed in the afternoon.

Must visit place

places.address: 7MM5+R66, Sri Ganapati Sachchidananda Ashrama, Mysuru - Ooty Rd, Gundurao Nagar, Datta Nagar, Mysuru, Karnataka 570025, India

places.generalDescription: Melody World Wax Museum is a charming attraction in Mysore, dedicated to music and housed in a heritage building since 2010. The museum features over 300 musical instruments from around the world, making it the largest collection of its kind in Karnataka. Visitors can explore 19 galleries showcasing approximately one hundred life-like wax effigies of renowned musicians representing various music genres.

sources.snippet: At a distance of around 3 km from Mysore Palace, on the Vihara Marg, Kurubara Halli, this is another popular and unique museum of Mysore city. Housed inside a heritage building, this museum has the largest collection of musical instruments in Karnataka. Apart from varied traditional and ancient musical instruments, the other major attraction here are the life size wax statues of musicians in traditional attires playing different instruments.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to Visit in Mysore

sources.snippet: Unlike typical wax museums,  Melody World Wax Museum is dedicated to music. There are more than 100 wax figures and 300 musical instruments on display in realistic settings. You can see Indian classical concerts and rock bands from around the world, which gives you a global view of music traditions.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Mysore, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: At a distance of 5 km from Mysore Railway Station, Melody World Wax Museum is a musical themed museum situated on Chamundi Hill Road in Mysore. Next to Karanji Lake, it is one of the popular wax museums in India, and among the prime places to visit in Mysore.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Special features: Wax museum, celebrity wax figures, interactive displays.Timings: 9:30 AM to 7:00 PMWebsite: No official website available.Location charges: INR 1,500 onwards for pre-wedding shoots (varies based on requirements).
sources.shortName: 20 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Mysore (October 2024)
25 Best Places to Visit in Mysore | Nearby Tourist Attractions

places.name: Melody World Wax Museum

reviews.text:
Melody World Wax Museum sighting is a marvelous experience as it displays many musical instruments from around the world, making it a great way to learn about the history of music. The wax statues and exhibits are very well arranged in an old building adding to its charm.
Great fun and informative place, definitely a visit will reward your time!

The whole concept of this is worth appreciating. The idea of wax statues to hold the real traditional musical instruments is just awesome. The maintenance is not that great. They could have arranged decent rooms. Also the add-ons are good. Worth place to visit once

Good collections of antique instruments, devices, utensils, cultural artifacts, etc.
The mirror maze was excellent.
The Horror house was average, not scary at all.
The place needs maintenance though.

places.address: 8M2H+W28, 1, Vihara Marga, Kurubara Halli, Siddhartha Layout, Mysuru, Karnataka 570011, India

places.generalDescription: St. Philomena's Cathedral, located in Mysore, is a stunning neo-gothic church with soaring twin spires and intricate stained glass windows depicting the Christ era. Built between 1933-1941, it was inspired by the Cologne Cathedral in Germany. The church houses a relic of Saint Philomena obtained in 1926 and features a candlelit prayer room that offers solace to visitors.

sources.snippet: In India one of the tallest churches is St. Philomena's Church that stands tall. Its twin towers as well as stained glass windows make it a good subject for architectural photography. Inside the church, light plays out beautifully in your photographs giving them an eerie effect especially in the morning or evening hours.
sources.shortName: Capture The Bliss With Top 7 Best Places For Photography In Mysuru

sources.snippet: Recognized as the second tallest church of Asia, St. Philomena's Church was constructed to pay tribute to the Catholic Saint and martyr of Roman Catholic Church, Saint Philomena. It is one of the most important historical sites in Mysore and is frequently visited by tourists from all over the country.
sources.shortName: 36 Best Places to visit in Mysore | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Special features: Neo-Gothic style cathedral, architectural beauty, serene ambiance.Timings: 5:00 AM to 6:00 PMWebsite: No official website.Location charges: INR 1,500 onwards for pre-wedding shoots (varies based on requirements).
sources.shortName: 20 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Mysore (October 2024)

sources.snippet: The 200-year old St. Philomena‚Äôs Church is also called as St. Joseph‚Äôs Church. The Church is built in Gothic Style. Originally, a small church was in the place.
sources.shortName: Stunning 8 Places In Mysore, The ‚ÄòCity Of Palaces‚Äô
12 Best Night Hangout Places in Mysore

sources.siteName: Be On The Road | Live your Travel Dream!
sources.shortName: Mysore Palace: A Destination for Photography Be On The Road

places.name: St. Joseph's Cathederal (St. Philomena's shrine)

reviews.text:
A Majestic Masterpiece of Faith and Architecture

St. Philomena's Cathedral is absolutely breathtaking. From the moment you step onto the grounds, you're greeted with towering spires and stunning neo-gothic architecture that rivals some of the finest cathedrals in Europe. The stained glass windows, especially the ones depicting scenes from the life of Christ, are nothing short of mesmerizing when sunlight streams through them.

Inside, the atmosphere is peaceful and reverent-perfect for prayer, reflection, or simply soaking in the beauty. The craftsmanship in every detail, from the altars to the ceiling arches, shows deep devotion and incredible artistry.

Whether you're religious or simply a lover of history and architecture, this cathedral is a must-visit. A true gem of Mysuru that leaves a lasting impression.

---

Want a shorter version or one with a more personal tone?

A peaceful and beautiful church with stunning architecture. The calm atmosphere makes it perfect for prayer and reflection. The stained glass windows and intricate design add to its charm. A must-visit for anyone seeking serenity and history in one place.

This beautiful Cathedral was built in 1956 and is one of the largest churches in the country. It has been built in the Gothic style with beautiful stain glass windows and lofty towers. The illuminated church in the evening is a wonderful site not to be missed.

The church's Gothic-style architecture, with its towering spires, stunning stained-glass windows, and intricate carvings, is a sight to behold. The serene atmosphere and peaceful ambiance make it an ideal spot for prayer, reflection, and contemplation.

The moment you step inside, the high ceilings and beautifully crafted interiors transport you to a different era. The altar, the sculptures, and the detailed carvings showcase the craftsmanship that went into building this historical church. The stained-glass windows depicting scenes from Christ's life add to the spiritual charm.

It's close to mysore palace 2.5km away and adjacent to muslim moholla. Absolute beauty to visit with friends or family and a must not place to miss during your next trip to Mysore.

places.address: 3042/1, Sawday Rd, near St. Chnilomina Church, Lashkar Mohalla, Lourdu Nagar, Mandi Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka 570001, India

places.generalDescription: The Jaganmohan Palace, also known as the Sri Jayachamarajendra Art Gallery, is a historic site located near Mysore City Bus Stand. Originally built in 1861 as a royal retreat, it now houses an impressive art gallery featuring paintings, carvings, and other artifacts. The palace showcases a diverse collection of artworks including paintings by renowned artists like Raja Ravi Varma and Col. Scot, depicting scenes from Hindu epics and historical conflicts.

sources.snippet: This palace is now an art gallery featuring works by some famous artists whose paintings are on display there for people interested in such things . Among other things that could be photographed include royal architecture, ornate doorways or broad open spaces found inside palace premises itself. Paintings along with sculptures displayed at museums offer great artistic subjects that reflect the city's cultural heritage.
sources.shortName: Capture The Bliss With Top 7 Best Places For Photography In Mysuru

sources.snippet: For those who love art and culture, Jaganmohan Palace is an essential stop. Built in 1861, it houses one of India‚Äôs richest art galleries, featuring original works by Raja Ravi Varma and rare Mysore-style paintings known for their gold leaf detailing. As you wander through the galleries, you see miniature paintings, sculptures, and royal antiques that reflect the city‚Äôs creative traditions.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Mysore, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2 km from Mysore Railway Station & 2 km from KSRTC Bus Station, the Jagan Mohan Palace which houses the Jayachamarajendra Art Gallery is located near the City Bus Stand in Mysore. It is one of the best-preserved art galleries in Karnataka, and among the most popular Mysore tourist places.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Special features: Art gallery, Mysorean and European paintings, sculptures.Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:30 PMWebsite: No official website available.Location charges: INR 1,000 onwards for pre-wedding shoots (varies based on requirements).
sources.shortName: 20 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Mysore (October 2024)

sources.snippet: The palace that housed the royals before the construction of The Mysore palace, this structure displays various paintings of the past kings of Mysore and is one of the oldest buildings in the city.
sources.shortName: 36 Best Places to visit in Mysore | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Jaganmohana Palace (Sri Jayachamarajendra Art Gallery) And Auditorium

reviews.text:
Jagmohan Palace is a true gem of Mysore! The architecture is stunning, showcasing intricate designs and a glimpse of royal heritage. The art gallery inside is a treasure trove for history and art enthusiasts, with an impressive collection of paintings, artifacts, and cultural exhibits. The maintenance of the palace is commendable, and the serene ambiance adds to the experience.

A must-visit for anyone exploring Mysore, whether you're into art, history, or simply admire beautiful architecture. Parking is convenient, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommended for tourists and locals alike!
Hidden gem of mysore, not a popular place visited by tourist. But must visit if you are art enthusiast. You can see Ravi varma originals here. üòç

If you are an art enthusiast, have 1-2 hours to peacefully stand and stare at the art pieces wondering at their beauty and reading about them, then this definitely is a perfect place for you. Kids might not find it very interesting as it is a collection of paintings and other art collections.
Needs a little more maintenance because the floors are squeaky and rooms are dusty. Some of the paintings are getting ruined and it's very disheartening.

Otherwise it's a very beautiful place !

places.address: 8J4X+QW5, Jagan Mohan Palace Road, Subbarayanakere, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570004, India

sources.snippet: At a distance of 8 km from Mysore Zoo & 13 km from Mysore Railway Station, Chamundi Hill Temple is a Hindu temple located in Mysore. It is one of the major places of pilgrimage in Karnataka, and among the must-visit places as part of Mysore tour packages.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Chamundi hills steps parking

reviews.text:
There are around 1200 steps, Timing is morning 5am to 6pm. There is plenty of space available for parking. climbing hours depend on climate and stamina, i climbed in 30mins in the early morning. At the middle one nandi statue is there which is very beautiful.
U will enjoy climbing with nature...

Awesome place with awesome and powerful Goddess!
The steps are 1008 and can be climbed in 1 hour based on my stamina. The journey through the steps was beautiful üòç. You also have view point at a rock and the experience was too good.
Must try for kids!!!

Love towards mother chamundi will make anybody climb the steps.
It was my first climb to her.
I felt so fresh and happy after I reached the top and had her darshan.

places.address: 7MM8+PFG, Chamundi Hill Steps, Chamundi Hill, Mysuru, Karnataka 570025, India

places.generalDescription: Sanjeevini Park in Mysore is a standout among parks, featuring fountains, beautifully sculpted models, and adorable animals. It's the perfect place to lift your spirits and escape into a little slice of heaven. The park also boasts a prominent statue of Happy Man resembling Laughing Buddha and offers well-maintained gardens and a mini zoo.

sources.snippet: Another park in Mysore that you might want to visit while on the city tour is the Sanjeevini Park. A well maintained park, with ample of open space and frondescence, it is quite famous among the residents as well. A giant golden laughing buddha is a major attraction here, where many visitors can be seen taking photographs.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to Visit in Mysore

places.name: Sanjeevini Park

reviews.text: Well maintained park.

It's a spacious park,idk if all parks in mysore are as big as it is, but there's a lot of varieties here from the live animals to the pond and all the statues. There's also these local food vendors outside the park. Overall it's a beautiful place to spent some time with ur loved ones.
Kids play ground and cartoon statues, pond ares with live small animals are available... Best place to kids play and walking for adults... Spend time with nature at free of cost with family.

places.address: 40, Kamakshi Hospital Rd, Kuvempunagara North, Kuvempu Nagara, Mysuru, Karnataka 570023, India

places.generalDescription: The Guinness World Record Sea Shell Art Museum is a small but fascinating place filled with amazing art made from shells. There are sculptures, buildings, and even jewelry made from these natural objects, and it's definitely worth checking out if you're into marine art. The ticket price is very reasonable, and the museum is very well-maintained.

sources.snippet: At a distance of 6 km from Mysore Railway Station, the Guinness World Record Sea Shell Art Museum is a private museum located on Chamundi Hill Road in Mysore. Situated near the Sand Sculpture Museum, it is a one-of-a-kind museum that can be visited as part of Mysore holiday packages.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Guinness World Record Sea Shell Art Museum

reviews.text:
Amazing world of sea shell art! This is a must-visit spot and It takes around 40‚Äì60 minutes to explore all the unique artifacts. Entry fee is ‚Çπ60 per person, and free parking is available. There's also a beautiful and large Taj Mahal, Ganesha, St. Philomena Cathedral, Shiva Temple, Dasha Avathaar, sculptures made entirely of original sea shells-absolutely superb, I really loved it.

You can also buy various handicrafts items and ornaments made with pure seashell. 360  reels capturing device also available. Definitely worth a visit!

Must visit place in Mysore. If you love craft work. You will definitely love this place. This place is not much crowded, you can visit this place while coming back from Chamundi temple. You may also meet Ms. Radha who has created this masterpiece. We got the opportunity to meet her and also had chit chat with her.

Fees for adult 60 rs. Free parking. 30 min u can spend. U can amazing shell art work here. Many types of shells they used. It seems nice. They made temple, church, Lord Shiva and Lord Vinayagar it's nice.

places.address: Chamundi Hill Road, JC Layout, Mysuru, Karnataka 570010, India

places.generalDescription: Devaraja Market is the oldest market complex in the city, offering a vibrant and chaotic traditional Indian market experience. With over 300 shops spread across 3 acres, it's a must-visit for tourists looking to immerse themselves in local flavors. The market features sections dedicated to fresh flowers and puja materials, making it a unique cultural experience. Additionally, the gallery within the market showcases renowned artworks by established artists, including Raja Ravi Verma and Rembrandt.

sources.siteName: Be On The Road | Live your Travel Dream!
sources.shortName: Mysore Palace: A Destination for Photography Be On The Road

places.name: Devaraja market

reviews.text:
captures the essence of Mysore's local culture. It's a bustling marketplace filled with fresh fruits, vegetables, flowers, spices, and traditional items. The fragrance of jasmine and incense sticks, combined with the vivid colors of fruits and flowers, creates an unforgettable sensory experience.

The market is well-organized, and the vendors are friendly, often engaging visitors with stories about their products. It's a great place to buy souvenirs like sandalwood products and Mysore silk at reasonable prices.

While it can get crowded, that's part of its charm.

stepping into Devaraja Market in Mysore is like entering a completely different world ‚Äì a vibrant, sensory overload in the best possible way! It's not your typical sterile shopping experience; it's raw, it's bustling, and it's full of life.
The first thing that hits you is the explosion of colors and smells. Piles upon piles of bright fruits and vegetables are everywhere ‚Äì the deep red of tomatoes, the vibrant yellow of bananas, the lush green of leafy vegetables. And the fragrance? A mix of sweet flowers, earthy spices, and fresh produce all mingling together. It's quite intoxicating!
What I loved is how authentic it feels. You see local vendors, many of whom have been there for generations, passionately selling their goods. There's a real buzz of interaction between them and the customers, a friendly banter that you don't often find in modern supermarkets.
You can find pretty much anything here, from fresh produce and flowers (oh, the marigolds and jasmine are just gorgeous!) to spices, incense, and even some household items. It's a feast for the senses at every turn.
Navigating through the narrow pathways can be a bit chaotic, with people and handcarts moving around, but that's part of its charm. It feels like you're right in the heart of the city's everyday life.
I spent a good amount of time just wandering around, taking it all in. I bought some fragrant spices and a few local fruits that I hadn't tried before. It felt good to support the local economy directly.
It's not a fancy, air-conditioned mall; it's a traditional market, and it has all the character that comes with that. If you want to experience the real pulse of Mysore and soak in the local culture, Devaraja Market is a must-visit. Just be prepared for the crowds and the sensory overload ‚Äì embrace it, and you'll have a fantastic time!
In a human way:
* It's a vibrant and bustling market with an explosion of colors and smells.
* You can find a wide variety of fresh produce, flowers, and spices.
* It feels very authentic, with local vendors and lively interactions.
* It's a great place to experience the local culture and support the community.
* Be prepared for crowds and a sensory-rich environment.
If you're looking for an authentic and lively experience in Mysore, Devaraja Market is definitely worth exploring. It's a sensory adventure!

Mysore Market, also known as Devaraja Market, is one of the oldest and most iconic marketplaces in Karnataka. Located in the center of Mysore city, it's not just a shopping destination-it's a cultural experience in itself. Walking through the market feels like stepping into a different world, where tradition and daily life blend seamlessly.

The first thing you'll notice is the explosion of colors-bright orange marigolds, red chilies, green herbs, and vibrant pigments used for religious and decorative purposes. The air is filled with the scent of fresh flowers, spices, and incense, creating a sensory experience that's truly unforgettable. Stalls are lined with fresh produce, aromatic oils, sandalwood products, and handmade items that reflect the craftsmanship of local artisans.

The market is well-organized, with separate sections for fruits and vegetables, flowers, puja items, and household goods. It's a great place to interact with locals, many of whom are eager to share stories or explain the use of their products. The vendors are generally friendly and open to bargaining, making it a fun place to shop.

What sets Mysore Market apart is its authenticity. Unlike commercial malls, it offers a raw and genuine glimpse into the daily life of Mysore's residents. It's also a photographer's dream, filled with colorful scenes and lively characters.

Whether you're a traveler, a photographer, a foodie, or just curious, Mysore Market is a must-visit. It's more than a place to shop-it's a place to connect with Mysore's soul.

places.address: 8M62+5X9, Sayyaji Rao Rd, Medar Block, Tilak Nagar, Mysuru, Karnataka 570001, India

places.generalDescription: Mysore Zoo Park is a popular weekend destination, offering a well-maintained animal kingdom that allows visitors to connect with nature. The zoo provides ample space and greenery, with amenities such as RO water stations and resting areas along the 3km walking path. Families can enjoy seeing a variety of wild animals in a clean and well-maintained environment, making it an outstanding place for leisurely visits. Additionally, the park's surroundings offer a rejuvenating experience for all visitors.

sources.snippet: Also known as the Mysore Maharaja Palace, it is the biggest thing that you will ever notice in Mysore!. The palace is situated in the city‚Äôs centre, so you know, it cannot be missed anyway. It is a must visit tourist attraction to include in Mysore travel Itinerary.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places to Visit in Mysore | Nearby Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Founded in 1892, Mysore Zoo is among the oldest and best-maintained zoological parks in India. Its wide enclosures give animals space to move naturally, making it a model for other zoos. Here you can see white tigers, elephants, giraffes, and even rare primates.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Mysore, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Mysore Zoo also known as Shri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens offers wonderful experience. This is one among the oldest zoos in India having been constructed in 1892. The Zoo is spread in a sprawling 250 acres of land and houses stunning range of species.
sources.shortName: Stunning 8 Places In Mysore, The ‚ÄòCity Of Palaces‚Äô

sources.snippet: At a distance of only 2 km from Mysore Palace, Mysore zoo was established by Chamarajendra Wadiyar Bahadur in 1892. Hence it is also known by the name of Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens. It used to be known as Khasa Bangle' or ‚ÄòPrivate Bungalow‚Äô.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to Visit in Mysore

sources.snippet: Special features: Zoological park, diverse wildlife, well-maintained enclosures.Timings: 8:30 AM to 5:30 PMWebsite: https://www.mysuruzoo.info/Location charges: INR 1,000 onwards for pre-wedding shoots (varies based on requirements).
sources.shortName: 20 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Mysore (October 2024)

sources.snippet: Above photo: Mysore palace‚Äôs beauty lies in its various elements. These are wall tiles, which could have been influenced by Persia or even our own very Chettinad region.
sources.siteName: Be On The Road | Live your Travel Dream!
sources.shortName: Mysore Palace: A Destination for Photography Be On The Road

places.name: Mysore zoo park

reviews.text: It is one of the best zoos of the country.Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens, popularly known as ‚ÄòMysuru Zoo', is one of the oldest zoos of the country established in 1892, by His Highness, the erstwhile Ruler of Mysuru Sri Chamarajendra Wadiyar Bahadur. Mysuru Zoo holds an important place in Karnataka. In 1909 the Palace Zoo was named as Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens to commemorate the illustrious founder and since then it bears the nomenclature. Mysuru Zoo has gradually grown into tourist centre, imparting wildlife values. It has got 123 years of history exhibiting wild animals in the near natural enclosures. Despite majority of the zoos have been shifted from the original place to the new places, Mysuru Zoo could modernize the zoo, without shifting the zoo. The zoo is well compacted unit, with modern animal enclosures including heritage buildings attracting tourists all over the world.Great place to visit with kids above 5 years, they really appreciate the variety of birds, animals and reptiles. It took us 4 hours to complete the walk around the entire Zoo, which included a 30 min break at the cafeteria, just to rest. The food at the cafeteria is primarily south Indian food, which didn't intrigue us much, since we were eating the same for the last couple of days. Make sure you wear the most comfortable shoes if you plan to walk, and carry a bottle, so you can fill it up at the watering stations, which are well spaced out, carry a cap, it's not too hot though cause of all the trees. There is also a buggy option, however they cover the entire Zoo in an hour and you don't get time to spend at each exhibit, it's a quick tour. The zoo doesn't permit plastics, or outside food, they check the bags at the entrance post buying your tickets.

Mysore Zoo is a wonderful place for animal lovers and those interested in studying wildlife. The zoo is clean, well-maintained, and thoughtfully organized with separate sections for birds, reptiles, wild animals, and more. Visitors can explore the zoo on foot, covering approximately 3 kilometers, or opt for electric buggies for convenience. I will recommend it by foot if you can make it, so you can manage where to spend time. The entry fee is ‚Çπ100 per person. The lush greenery throughout the zoo provides a soothing and refreshing atmosphere. The walkways are beautifully designed, making the visit even more enjoyable.  It's a must-visit destination, especially for families with kids, offering a unique and memorable experience to spend quality time together.

Mysore zoo was a wonderful place for the people who love animals and who study about the wildlife. The zoo was clean and well maintained. There are separate areas for birds , reptiles, wild animals etc. Around 2 km we need to walk to see the zoo. There are ev buggies available in the zoo . There is an entry fee of 100 per person. Some areas of the zoo need to improve. In the zoo there is really good greenery which cools our eyes. The walkway of the zoo was beautiful.

places.address: Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens, Zoo Rd, Indiranagar, Mysuru, Karnataka 570010, India

places.generalDescription: Kukkarahalli Lake, established in 1864 by Mummadi Krishnaraja Wodeyar, offers a 4.5km walking path with stone benches for visitors to relax and enjoy the scenic views. The lake is a popular spot for bird watching, with various species such as spot-billed pelicans, little cormorants, painted storks, and more.

sources.snippet: Placed right in the heart of Mysore city in the vicinity of the University of Mysore, the picturesque J-shaped Kukkarahalli lake offers an ideal ambience to spend some quality time in nature‚Äôs midst. The lake is spread over an area of 62 hectares (150 acres). It was created in the year 1864 at the behest of king Mummadi Krishnaraja Wodeyar, a great ruler of the Kingdom of Mysore.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Places in Mysore To Visit

sources.snippet: At a distance of 3.5 Kms from Mysore Railway Station & 4 Kms from KSRTC Bus Station, Kukkarahalli Lake is situated in the heart of the Mysore City and lies in the vicinity of the University of Mysore. The Kukkarahalli Lake or Kukkarahalli Kere was built in 1864 AD by Dewan Poornaiah. This lake sprawls over an area of 120 acres.
sources.shortName: 56 Best Places to Visit in Mysore, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Special features: Serene lake, birdwatching, nature trails.Timings: 6:00 AM to 6:00 PMWebsite: No official website available.Location charges: No specific charges for photography.
sources.shortName: 20 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Places in Mysore (October 2024)

places.name: Kukkarahalli Lake

reviews.text:
Beautiful lake. Visited after 42 years. Trail is good.

One side is beautiful lake view and other side is water bottles and trash.. why can't they have trash cans every few feet?

Suggestion: Use a golf cart with trailers to pick up trash if people don't want to walk to pick up trash.

Kukkarahalli Lake is a peaceful and scenic spot, ideal for early morning jogs or quiet evening strolls. The walking path is well-maintained, and benches are available along the way to sit and take in the view. It's also a fantastic location for photography-especially during the migratory season when a variety of birds flock to the lake. Birdwatchers and nature photographers will really enjoy it. The surroundings are calm and refreshing, making it a great escape from the city's chaos. Having clean and accessible washrooms would further enhance the visitor experience, but overall, it's a beautiful and worth visiting.

Kukkarahalli Lake in Mysuru is a serene and scenic destination, perfect for nature lovers, joggers, and birdwatchers alike. Nestled within the heart of the city, the lake offers a peaceful 4.5 km walking trail surrounded by lush greenery, making it an ideal spot for early morning walks or relaxing evening strolls. Visitors often praise the area for its cleanliness, cool shade from trees, and abundance of birds-especially during migratory seasons. The lake is home to species like pelicans, storks, and kingfishers, attracting photographers and wildlife enthusiasts. Though boating has been discontinued, the charm of the lake remains intact, with quiet corners to sit, reflect, or write. Some minor concerns include occasional water quality issues and a lack of public restrooms. Despite this, Kukkarahalli Lake continues to be a beloved urban escape, celebrated not only for its ecological beauty but also its cultural heritage, having inspired many local writers and poets. Entry is free, and the lake is easily accessible from key areas of Mysore.

places.generalDescription: The Folklore Museum, located in the grand former palace on the University of Mysore campus, showcases a vast collection of indigenous art forms, artifacts, and handicraft items from Karnataka. With over 6,500 exhibits including depictions of art, culture, literature, dance, drama and music from the state. The museum also houses Palaeolithic tools found during excavations at various districts.

sources.snippet: Another interesting museum to visit in Mysore is the Folklore Museum. Established in 1968, this museum, as the name suggests, focusses on the varied folk arts and crafts of Karnataka. It has a rich collection of more than 6500 archives about dance, literature, music and various other arts forms from all over the state.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to Visit in Mysore

places.name: Folklore Museum

reviews.text: One of the finest place in Mysore for Art lovers. Age-old handicrafts, antics and Royal artefacts are on display in a royal mansion. A beautiful mansion housing the Museum is place to visit and enjoyed. It is in the Mysore University campus some 4 km from the Mysore Railway Station.

Currently, the museum is closed till Feb2027. excellent museum inside Mysore University campus. They should charge nominal amount atleast to maintain building which is in bad shape now. 3 sections are there. photography is not allowed. management should rethink on this so that visitors can preserve memories better. worldwide, photography allowed inside the museum.

I could not enter the museum as it was temporarily closed for repair. This place is inside University of Mysore and I loved the beautiful campus that they have. And inside this campus, resides this palace of your dreams.
